source:
# Dependencies and Setup
%matplotlib inline
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Hide warning messages in notebook
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# File to Load (Remember to Change These)
clinical_trial_data_to_load = "clinicaltrial_data.csv"
mouse_drug_data_to_load = "mouse_drug_data.csv"

# Read the Mouse and Drug Data and the Clinical Trial Data
clinical_trial_data = pd.read_csv("clinicaltrial_data.csv")
mouse_drug_data = pd.read_csv("mouse_drug_data.csv")

# Combine the data into a single dataset
combined_data = pd.merge(clinical_trial_data, mouse_drug_data, how="outer", on = "Mouse ID")


# Display the data table for preview
combined_data.head()
## Tumor Response to Treatment

#TUMOR RESPONSE TO TREATMENT
#Store the Mean Tumor Volume Data Grouped by Drug and Timepoint 
grouped_data = combined_data.groupby(["Drug", "Timepoint"])

tumor_mean = grouped_data["Tumor Volume (mm3)"].mean()

#Convert to DataFrame
tumor_mean_df = pd.DataFrame(tumor_mean).reset_index()

#Preview DataFrame
tumor_mean_df.head()

source:
#Store the Standard Error of Tumor Volumes Grouped by Drug and Timepoint 
grouped_data = combined_data.groupby(["Drug", "Timepoint"])
tumor_se = grouped_data["Tumor Volume (mm3)"].sem()

#Convert to DataFrame
tumor_se_df = pd.DataFrame(tumor_se).reset_index()

#Preview DataFrame
tumor_se_df.head()

# Minor Data Munging to Re-Format the Data Frames
pivot_data_tumor= tumor_mean_df.pivot(index = "Timepoint",columns = "Drug",values = "Tumor Volume (mm3)")

# Preview that Reformatting worked
pivot_data_tumor

# Generate the Plot (with Error Bars)
#Set the x-axis variable
Time = [0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45]

#Set the yerr variable (error bar height size)
Capomulin_se= tumor_se_df.loc[tumor_se_df["Drug"]=="Capomulin","Tumor Volume (mm3)"]
Infubinol_se= tumor_se_df.loc[tumor_se_df["Drug"]=="Infubinol","Tumor Volume (mm3)"]
Ketapril_se= tumor_se_df.loc[tumor_se_df["Drug"]=="Ketapril","Tumor Volume (mm3)"]
Placebo_se= tumor_se_df.loc[tumor_se_df["Drug"]=="Placebo","Tumor Volume (mm3)"]

#Set the error bar plots
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_tumor["Capomulin"], yerr= Capomulin_se, label= "Capomulin", marker="o", color="red", linestyle="--")  
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_tumor["Infubinol"], yerr=Infubinol_se, label ="Infubinol", marker="^", color="blue", linestyle= "--")
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_tumor["Ketapril"], yerr=Ketapril_se, label ="Ketapril", marker="D", color="green", linestyle= "--")
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_tumor["Placebo"], yerr=Infubinol_se, label ="Placebo", marker="s", color="black", linestyle= "--")

#Set grid horizontal lines
ax = plt.axes()        
ax.yaxis.grid(which="major", color='grey', linestyle='-', linewidth=1)

#Set the graph legends, titles and axis labels
plt.legend()
plt.title("Tumor Response to Treatment")
plt.xlabel("Time (Days)")
plt.ylabel("Tumor Volume (mm3)")

#Save the Figure
plt.savefig("Images/Tumor_Response.png")

#Show the Figure
plt.show()
![Tumor Response to Treatment](../Images/treatment.png)
## Metastatic Response to Treatment

grouped_data = combined_data.groupby(["Drug","Timepoint"])
metastatic_mean = grouped_data["Metastatic Sites"].mean()

#Convert to DataFrame
metastatic_mean_df = pd.DataFrame(metastatic_mean).reset_index()

#Preview DataFrame
metastatic_mean_df.head()

# Store the Standard Error associated with Met. Site Data Grouped by Drug and Timepoint 
grouped_data = combined_data.groupby(["Drug","Timepoint"])
metastatic_se = grouped_data["Metastatic Sites"].sem()

#Convert to DataFrame
metastatic_se_df = pd.DataFrame(metastatic_se).reset_index()

#Preview DataFrame
metastatic_se_df.head()

# Minor Data Munging to Re-Format the Data Frames
pivot_data_metastatic= metastatic_mean_df.pivot(index = "Timepoint",columns = "Drug",values = "Metastatic Sites")

# Preview that Reformatting worked
pivot_data_metastatic

# Generate the Plot (with Error Bars)
#Set the x-axis variable
Time = [0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45]

#Set the yerr variable (error bar height size)
Capomulin_se= metastatic_se_df.loc[metastatic_se_df["Drug"]=="Capomulin","Metastatic Sites"]
Infubinol_se= metastatic_se_df.loc[metastatic_se_df["Drug"]=="Infubinol","Metastatic Sites"]
Ketapril_se= metastatic_se_df.loc[metastatic_se_df["Drug"]=="Ketapril","Metastatic Sites"]
Placebo_se= metastatic_se_df.loc[metastatic_se_df["Drug"]=="Placebo","Metastatic Sites"]

#Set the error bar plots
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_metastatic["Capomulin"], yerr= Capomulin_se, label= "Capomulin", marker="o", color="red", linestyle="--")  
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_metastatic["Infubinol"], yerr=Infubinol_se, label ="Infubinol", marker="^", color="blue", linestyle= "--")
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_metastatic["Ketapril"], yerr=Ketapril_se, label ="Ketapril", marker="D", color="green", linestyle= "--")
plt.errorbar(Time, pivot_data_metastatic["Placebo"], yerr=Infubinol_se, label ="Placebo", marker="s", color="black", linestyle= "--")

#Set grid horizontal lines
ax = plt.axes()        
ax.yaxis.grid(which="major", color='grey', linestyle='-', linewidth=1)

#Set the graph legends, titles and axis labels
plt.legend()
plt.title("Metastatic Spread During Treatment")
plt.xlabel("Treatment Duration (Days)")
plt.ylabel("Met. Sites")

#Save the Figure
plt.savefig("Images/Spread.png")

#Show the Figure
plt.show()
![Metastatic Spread During Treatment](../Images/spread.png)
## Survival Rates

#SURVIVAL RATES 
# Store the Count of Mice Grouped by Drug and Timepoint (W can pass any metric)
grouped_data = combined_data.groupby(["Drug", "Timepoint"])
mice_count = grouped_data["Mouse ID"].count()

# Convert to DataFrame
mice_count_df = pd.DataFrame(mice_count).reset_index()

# Rename the column "Mouse ID" to "Mouse Count"
renamed_df = mice_count_df.rename(columns={"Mouse ID":"Mouse Count"})

# Preview DataFrame
renamed_df.head()

# Minor Data Munging to Re-Format the Data Frames
pivot_data_mice= renamed_df.pivot(index = "Timepoint", columns= "Drug", values = "Mouse Count")

# Preview the Data Frame
pivot_data_mice

# Generate the Plot (Accounting for percentages)
#Set the x-axis variable
Time = [0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45]

#Set the line plots
plt.plot(Time, (pivot_data_mice["Capomulin"]/25)*100, label= "Capomulin", marker="o", color="red", linestyle="--")  
plt.plot(Time, (pivot_data_mice["Infubinol"]/25)*100, label ="Infubinol", marker="^", color="blue", linestyle= "--")
plt.plot(Time, (pivot_data_mice["Ketapril"]/25)*100, label ="Ketapril", marker="D", color="green", linestyle= "--")
plt.plot(Time, (pivot_data_mice["Placebo"]/25)*100, label ="Placebo", marker="s", color="black", linestyle= "--")

#Set grid 
plt.grid(which="major", color='grey', linestyle='-', linewidth=1)

#Set the graph legends, titles and axis labels
plt.legend()
plt.title("Survival During Treatment")
plt.xlabel("Time (Days)")
plt.ylabel("Survival Rate (%)")

#Save the Figure
plt.savefig("Images/Survival.png")

# Show the Figure
plt.show()
![Metastatic Spread During Treatment](../Images/survival.png)
## Summary Bar Graph

source:
#SUMMARY BAR GRAPH
# Calculate the percent changes for each drug

Initial_tumor_value = 45
Percent_change = ((pivot_data_tumor.loc[45,:]-Initial_tumor_value)/Initial_tumor_value)*100

# Display the data to confirm
Percent_change

# Splice the data between passing and failing drugs
passing_drug = Percent_change < 0

# Orient widths. Add labels, tick marks, etc. 
drug_list = ['Capomulin','Infubinol','Ketapril','Placebo']
change_list = [(Percent_change[drug])for drug in drug_list]
change_plt = plt.bar(drug_list,change_list,width=-1,align='edge',color=passing_drug.map({True:'g',False:'r'}))
plt.grid()
plt.ylim(-30,70)
plt.ylabel('% Tumor Volume Change')
plt.title('Tumor Change Over 45 Day Treatment')

# Use functions to label the percentages of changes
def autolabel(rects):
    for rect in rects:
        height = rect.get_height()
        if height > 0:
            label_position = 2
        else:
            label_position = -8
        plt.text(rect.get_x() + rect.get_width()/2., label_position,
                '%d' % int(height)+'%',color='white',
                ha='center', va='bottom')
                
# Call functions to implement the function calls
autolabel(change_plt)

# Save the Figure
plt.savefig("Images/Change.png")

# Show the Figure
plt.show()
![Metastatic Spread During Treatment](../Images/change.png)

#OBSERVATION 1: "TUMOR RESPONSE TO TREATMENT"
# From the four drugs observed (Camopulin, Infubinol, Ketrapil, Placebo), "Camopulin"is the only one
# that reduces continously the tumor volume during the treatment. The other drugs do not reduce it. If we also
#look at "Tumor Change Over 45 Days Treatment" it can be concluded that Camopulin reduces the initial tumor volume
#size from the begining of the treatment to the end (45 days after) in a 19%. rest of drugs increases the tumor
#sizes considerably (46%, 57% and 51%).

#OBSERVATION 2: "METASTATIC SPREAD DURING TREATMENT"
# From the four drugs observed (Camopulin, Infubinol, Ketrapil, Placebo), "Camopulin"is the drug that achieves 
# fewer spread of the number of metastatic points during the treatment. At the end of the treatment with Camopulin
# the average of metastatic points is almost 1.5, followed by Infubinol with an average of more than 2 points and 
# finally, by Ketrapil and Placebo that double the number of points spread, more than 3, compare to Camopulin 
# at the end of the period treatment.

#OBSERVATION 3: "SURVIVAL DURING TREATMENT"
# From the four drugs observed (Camopulin, Infubinol, Ketrapil, Placebo), "Camopulin" percentage rate of survival
#is more than 80% while for the other Drugs this rate is bellow 40%.

#FINAL CONCLUSION: all 3 observations confirms that if we compare the 4 drugs, Camopulin is the one that has better
# results in order to reduces Tummor volumes, limit the Spread of Metastatic points, and have a better rate of 
#survival during the period of treatment.
